toolkit.name: com.ibm.streamsx.thrift
toolkit.description:
Support for [http://thrift.apache.org|thrift] protocol.
This toolkit provides thrift server and thrift client functionality. Thrift idl file and thrift c++ code are generated automatically based on SPL type definitions.
The toolkit supports operator port schemas with basic types as well as collections of basic types.
Below a table of the supported basic types:
thrift SPL
binary blob bool boolean byte int8 i16 int16 i32 int32 i64 int64 double float64 string rstring
**Third-party libraries** * This toolkit embeds thrift headers/binaries under impl/include|lib|bin.

primitiveOp.name: ThriftSource
primitiveOp.description:
ThriftSource exposes a single thrift service with a number of functions defined, the number of functions is equivalent to the number of output ports. The operator acts as multithreaded server and supports multiple client connections.
The following mapping from SPL to thrift definitions is taking place: * The name of the first output port maps to the thrift service name (also to the name of the generated thrift file - e.g. ThriftSource_1.thrift). * Each output port schema maps to a thrift function parameters accordingly. * Each input port schema maps to a thrift function response accordingly.
Number of input ports may vary from 0 to the number of the output ports. Each input port correlates to the corresponding output port. If there are output ports that do not have a corresponding input ports, then no two-way functions are generated for them. If no input ports exist at all then only one-way functions are generated.
Input ports defined as control and can be called from any downstream operator (to supply a response to a waiting thrift client call).

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The mandatory 'uint32' parameter specifies thrift service listener port.

parameter.name: thriftOutputDir
parameter.description: The optional 'rstring' parameter specifies output directory for a generated thrift file. The default value is './etc'.

inputPort.description: Each input port generates a new thrift service two-way function and defines the schema of the function return value, while the function input is defined the same as a relative output port. The output tuple attributes are mapped to the function parameters accordingly. The input tuple attributes are mapped to the function response object accordingly.

outputPort.description: Each output port generates a new thrift service one-way function and defines the schema of the function input. The output tuple attributes are mapped to the function parameters accordingly.

primitiveOp.name: ThriftSink
primitiveOp.description:
ThriftSink defines an external thrift service with a single one-way function call. The operator acts as a single connection thrift client.
The following mapping from SPL to thrift definitions is taking place: * The name of the output port maps to the thrift service name (also to the name of the generated thrift file - e.g. ThriftSink_1.thrift). * The input port schema maps to a thrift function parameters accordingly.
Only one input port is supported. The generated thrift function is always one-way.

parameter.name: serverHost
parameter.description: The mandatory 'rstring' parameter specifies thrift server host to connect.

parameter.name: serverPort
parameter.description: The mandatory 'uint32' parameter specifies thrift server port to connect.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The optional 'float64' parameter specifies connection timeout in seconds. The default value is 120.0.

parameter.name: sendTimeout
parameter.description: The optional 'float64' parameter specifies send timeout in seconds. The default value is 120.0.

parameter.name: thriftOutputDir
parameter.description: The optional 'rstring' parameter specifies output directory for a generated thrift file. The default value is './etc'.

inputPort.description: The input port defines the schema of thrift function input. The input tuple attributes are mapped to the function parameters accordingly.

primitiveOp.name: ThriftCall
primitiveOp.description:
ThriftCall defines an external thrift service with a single two-way function call. The operator acts as a single connection thrift client.
The following mapping from SPL to thrift definitions is taking place: * The name of the output port maps to the thrift service name (also to the name of the generated thrift file - e.g. ThriftCall_1.thrift). * The input port schema maps to a thrift function parameters accordingly. * The output port schema maps to a thrift function response accordingly.
Only one input/output ports are supported. The generated thrift function is always two-way.

parameter.name: serverHost
parameter.description: The mandatory 'rstring' parameter specifies thrift server host to connect.

parameter.name: serverPort
parameter.description: The mandatory 'uint32' parameter specifies thrift server port to connect.

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description: The optional 'float64' parameter specifies connection timeout in seconds. The default value is 120.0.

parameter.name: sendTimeout
parameter.description: The optional 'float64' parameter specifies send timeout in seconds. The default value is 120.0.

parameter.name: receiveTimeout
parameter.description: The optional 'float64' parameter specifies response timeout in seconds. The default value is 120.0.

parameter.name: thriftOutputDir
parameter.description: The optional 'rstring' parameter specifies output directory for a generated thrift file. The default value is './etc'.

inputPort.description: The input port defines the schema of thrift function input. The input tuple attributes are mapped to the function parameters accordingly.

outputPort.description: The output port defines the schema of thrift function return value. The output tuple attributes are mapped to the function response object accordingly.
